attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
How the Hunting Act is negatively affecting most aspects of our society:

1 Education and skills
The skills learnt working w/ + riding to hounds are invaluable. Animal husbandry, the value of hard work, respect of community.. a long list
2 Employment, jobs and careers
Industry is busy and thriving. Should the Hunting Act eventually lead to hunting's demise, which I dearly hope it never will, these skills and jobs would go
4 Environment
The conservational benefits of hunting are significant and proven, inc. the positive effects of managing woodland
5 Government and politics
1000s of people have lost all respect for government and politics. The nanny state one step too far, has only set precedent for more bans 
6. Leisure and culture
So many people's favourite thing to do in their every spare second: follow hounds. Culture! There is almost nothing more intrinsic to the fabric of British heritage
7 Life in the community
Hunting brings together many different people, and is so much a part of life for thousands of people all around the country

Because of above, and the 1000 other reasons this legislation is unworkable + ridiculous, I implore the government to repeal the Hunting Act 2004

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
